intro: Epidendrum anchinocturnum, commonly known as the night-blooming epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that open at night and close by morning, a trait that aids in pollination by nocturnal insects. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and deriving moisture and nutrients from the air and rain.
